intro: Centaurium nudicaule, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, bright yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Centaurium nudicaule is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
